channel.title: vim_announce
channel.description: Important announcements for Vim, the text editor

item.title: Re: Vim 8.0 released!
item.description: Tumbler Terrall wrote: > > Announcing: Vim (Vi IMproved) version 8.0 > > > > > > This the first major Vim release in ten years. There are interesting > > new features, many small improvements and lots of bug fixes. > > Awesome! Thanks for everything! > > Oh, just curious. Are you going
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim 8.0 released!
item.description: Hello Vim users! Announcing: Vim (Vi IMproved) version 8.0 This the first major Vim release in ten years. There are interesting new features, many small improvements and lots of bug fixes. Among the new features are: - Asynchronous I/O support, channels, JSON - Jobs - Timers -
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim 7.4y ready for beta testing
item.description: Hello Vim users! Announcing: Vim (Vi IMproved) version 7.4y BETA This is the second BETA release for Vim 8. Same files as 7.4x but with a few more changes. Please report anything that isn't right. That includes a crash but also a typo in the documentation or a missing file. Once you
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vimfest Berlin
item.description: Hello Vim users, If you are interested in meeting Vim users: Vimfest is happening in Berlin Sept. 16-18. The schedule is now available: http://vimfest.org/#agenda I'll be doing a talk on Saturday. If you plan to join, please register, so they have an idea of how many people to expect. --
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim 7.4x ready for beta testing
item.description: Hello Vim users, Announcing: Vim (Vi IMproved) version 7.4x BETA This is the first BETA release for Vim 8 Please check that the distribution is OK. I haven't done one for a long time. Report anything that isn't right. That includes a crash but also a typo in the documentation or a
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.description: Skywind3000 wrote: > > Hello Vim users, > > > > Work on Vim 8.0 is coming close to an end. I hope version 8.0 can be > > released in about two weeks. > > > > This is a last chance to modify new features in a way that is not > > backwards compatible. Once 8.0 is out we can't make changes
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim 8 pre-announcement
item.description: Hello Vim users, Work on Vim 8.0 is coming close to an end. I hope version 8.0 can be released in about two weeks. This is a last chance to modify new features in a way that is not backwards compatible. Once 8.0 is out we can't make changes that would break plugins. An overview of new
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim charity: visit report
item.description: Hello Vim users, Vim users are asked to support a project in Uganda, donations for Vim are used to help poor children. I have visited the project to see what is going on there and what they are doing with the money. You can read it here: www.iccf.nl/news.html You can find pictures here:
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim charity: financial report 2015
item.description: Hello Vimmers, Vim users are asked to support a project in Uganda, and many have donated money in 2015. The ICCF foundation takes care of this and the financial report is now available, see the attachment. Also available in Dutch: http://www.iccf.nl/jaarrekening2015nl.pdf I am very thankful
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim calendar for 2016
item.description: Hello Vim users, I have updated the handy desktop calendar for 2016. It prints on one sheet of paper and, after folding and applying a bit of glue, stands on your desk. It is available in English and Dutch. You can find the PDF files on my website: http://moolenaar.net/#Calendar If you
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim donations
item.description: Hello Vim users, I keep getting a steady stream of donations. I thought you might want to know how much this actually is, so here is an overview of this year so far: 2015 Jan 4806 euro 2015 Feb 1250 euro 2015 Mar 1246 euro 2015 Apr 5153 euro
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim has moved from Google Code to Github
item.description: Hello Vim users, The announced move is done! The cleaned up git repository is available on GitHub. You can start using it, see http://www.vim.org/git.php If you previously had synced from the Mercurial repository on Google Code, you can either just drop it and start using GitHub, or switch
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim is moving from Google Code to Github
item.description: Hello Vim users, If you never use the Mercurial repository or deal with issues, you can stop reading now. Google Code is shutting down, the Vim project is being moved to Github. While this is happening, no changes are to be made. Especially, don't add new issues or edit existing issues.
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim-multibyte mailing list is closed
item.description: Hello Vim users, The number of messages on the vim-multibyte mailing list has gone down to nothing. Multi-byte text is a core part of Vim these days, mainly because UTF-8 is wide spread now. Therefore I have closed the vim-multibyte maillist. The archive will remain, but posting new
item.author: Bram Moolenaar

item.title: Vim charity: financial report 2014
item.description: Hello Vim users, Vim users are asked to support a project in Uganda, and many have sent money in 2014. The ICCF foundation takes care of this and the financial report is now available: http://www.iccf.nl/jaarrekening2014en.pdf Also available in Dutch: http://www.iccf.nl/jaarrekening2014nl.pdf
item.author: Bram Moolenaar
